description.div: Development of appreciation of beauty of line, form, color, and texture; judgment in the fine use of things pertaining to everyday living. Selecting, evaluating, and arranging many forms of art expression.
Analysis of social, cultural, aesthetic, and economic influences on clothing and human behavior.

prerequisite.div: Good standing in the University Honors Program or by invitation.

description.div: Analysis of social, cultural, aesthetic, and economic influences on clothing and human behavior.

course.title: Visual Literacy Lab: Analysis and/or Composition

prerequisite.div: ARTP: Art major or candidate for teaching endorsement in art. ARCH: Admission to the College of Architecture. IDES: Admission to the College of Architecture. JGEN: College of Journalism and Mass Communications major and 2.75 GPA. LARC: Admission to the College of Architecture. TXCD: Textiles, Clothing and Design major or minor.

description.div: Development of creative and perceptual analytic skills through problem solving in design. Composition and analysis.

prerequisite.div: ARTP: Art major or candidate for teaching endorsement in art. ARCH: Admission to the College of Architecture. IDES: Admission to the College of Architecture. JGEN: College of Journalism and Mass Communications major and 2.75 GPA. LARC: Admission to the College of Architecture. TXCD: Textiles, Clothing and Design major or minor.

description.div: Development of creative and perceptual analytic skills through problem solving in drawing and design. Composition and perceptual drawing.

prerequisite.div: ARTP: Art major or candidate for teaching endorsement in art.  ARCH: Admission to the College of Architecture. IDES: Admission to the College of Architecture. JGEN: College of Journalism and Mass Communications major and 2.75 GPA. LARC: Admission to the College of Architecture. TXCD: Textiles, Clothing and Design major or minor.

description.div: Development of creative and perceptual analytic skills through problem solving in drawing and design. Composition and color theory application.

prerequisite.div: ARTP: Art major or candidate for teaching endorsement in art. ARCH: Admission to the College of Architecture. IDES: Admission to the College of Architecture. JGEN: College of Journalism and Mass Communications major and 2.75 GPA. LARC: Admission to the College of Architecture. TXCD: Textiles, Clothing and Design major or minor.

description.div: Development of creative and perceptual analytic skills through problem solving in drawing and design. Composition and perceptual drawing.

prerequisite.div: ARTP: Art major or candidate for teaching endorsement in art. ARCH: Admission to the College of Architecture. IDES: Admission to the College of Architecture. JOUR: College of Journalism and Mass Communications major and 2.75 GPA. LARC: Admission to the College of Architecture. TXCD: Textiles, Clothing and Design major or minor.

description.div: Images change perceptions, the historic and economic underpinnings of visual communications, and the effects of images on individuals and groups. Advertising, typography, graphic design, photography, television, video, motion pictures, cartoons and the Internet.

prerequisite.div: ARTP: Art major or candidate for teaching endorsement in art. ARCH: Admission to the College of Architecture. IDES: Admission to the College of Architecture. JGEN: College of Journalism and Mass Communications major and 2.75 GPA. LARC: Admission to the College of Architecture. TXCD: Textiles, Clothing and Design major or minor.

description.div: Introduction to issues in Visual Literacy as they relate to art and design. Formal and critical analysis.

prerequisite.div: Sophomore standing.

description.div: Fibers, yarns, fabric construction, and finishes as they affect use and care.
Analysis and evaluation of apparel structure. Design, style, and construction variations as related to quality, price, and performance.

course.title: Product Development I: Apparel Analysis and Development

description.div: Analysis and evaluation of apparel structure. Design, style, and construction variations as related to quality, price, and performance.

course.title: Merchandising I: Textile and Apparel Industry

description.div: Textile and apparel industry processes. Social, cultural, and economic influences on the industry including entrepreneurship.

prerequisite.div: TXCD 212.

description.div: Creative experience in apparel design through the use of flat pattern methods.

prerequisite.div: For Merchandising or Textile Science option: ARTP/ARCH/IDES/JGEN/LARC/TXCD 141A and 141B. For Textile, Clothing and Design's Communication option: ARTP/ARCH/IDES/JGEN/LARC/TXCD 140A and 140B. For Textiles and Apparel Design option: ARPT/ARCH/IDES/JGEN/LARC/TXCD 140A, 140B, 141A, 141B, and 143.

description.div: Introduction to surface design with creative applications of printing and dyeing techniques on fabric.

course.title: Product Development II: Fashion Analysis and Presentation

prerequisite.div: TXCD major. For Merchandising or Textile Science option: ARTP/ARCH/IDES/JGEN/LARC/TXCD 141A and 141B. For Textiles Clothing and Design's Communications option: ARTP/ARCH/IDES/JGEN/LARC/TXCD 140A AND 140B. For Textiles and Apparel Design option: ARTP/ARCH/IDES/JGEN/LARC/TXCD 140A, 140B, 141A, 141B, and 143; TXCD 206, 212, and 213.

description.div: Drawing garments and the fashion figure. Aesthetic styling and presentation, refining product specifications, and interpretations of current trends. Intermediate application of computer-aided design in flat drawings and visual presentations.

course.title: Merchandising II: Merchandise Buying and Control

prerequisite.div: ACCT 201/201H/201X and 3 hrs MATH.

description.div: Role and responsibilities of apparel and/or home furnishings merchandisers in a retail operation. Fundamentals of merchandise mathematics and its application to computer technology.

prerequisite.div: For Merchandising or Textiles Science option: ARTP/ARCH/IDES/JGEN/LARC/TXCD: 141A and 141B. For Textile, Clothing and Design's Communications option: ARTP/ARCH/IDES/JGEN/LARC/TXCD: 140A and 140B. For Textiles and Apparel Design option: ARTP/ARCH/IDES/JGEN/LARC/TXCD 140A, 140B, 141A, 141B, 143; or ARCH 210.

description.div: Merchandise presentation designed to convey both image and merchandise to a target customer. The artistic and marketing functions of the retail environment.

prerequisite.div: Junior standing; TXCD 206.

description.div: Creative application of woven and non-loom textile construction techniques.
Readings in current literature and individual problems.

prerequisite.div: TXCD 212 and 216.

notes.div: This course is taught every other year. Check with adviser and/or department when planning course work.

description.div: Creative experience in designing apparel through the use of draping techniques.

prerequisite.div: TXCD 206; CHEM 105 or 109 or 113.

description.div: Recent advances in the production and performance of fibers, yarns, finishes and dyes for textile products. Lab experiences designed to familiarize the students with standards, methods and equipment for evaluating textile product performance.

prerequisite.div: TXCD 206.

notes.div: TXCD 406/806 is taught every other year. Check with adviser and/or department when planning course work.

description.div: Physical and chemical analysis of textiles using standard testing procedures. The calculation, interpretation, and evaluation of test results.

prerequisite.div: Junior standing, AHIS 101 or 102 or 3 hrs HIST 100 or 101.

description.div: Theoretical approach to the history of dress from ancient times through the twentieth century; examining dress in the context of social, economic, and artistic development of Western culture.

prerequisite.div: Junior standing, TXCD 206, AHIS 101 or 102 or 3 hrs HIST 100 or 101.

description.div: Textiles in the context of artistic, social, political, and economic developments in the cultures of Europe, Asia, Africa and the Americas. Emphasis on evolution of textile design and stylistic differences between cultures.

prerequisite.div: Senior standing; 3 hrs PSYC or SOCI; TXCD 123.

description.div: Theories and research findings about the social and psychological aspects of clothing and appearance in relation to the self and others.

course.title: Product Development III: Trend Analysis and Product Conceptualization

prerequisite.div: For Merchandising option: TXCD 312, 314, and MRKT 341. For Textile and Apparel Design option: TXCD 225, 312, 403/803, and MRKT 341. For Textile Science option and for the Textile, Clothing and Design's Communications option: TXCD 312.

notes.div: TXCD 412/812 is taught every other year. Check with your adviser and/or the TXCD department when planning course work.

description.div: Synthesis of processes involved in product development from product initiation to the development of market strategies. Career and portfolio development.

course.title: Merchandising III: Merchandise Development and Sourcing

prerequisite.div: ACCT 201 or 201H; MRKT 341 or 341H; TXCD 313 and 314.

description.div: Sourcing and problems involved in the merchandising of textiles and apparel, cultural and economic aspects of textile and apparel distribution, structure of the industry, and marketing practices specific to the textile and apparel industry.

prerequisite.div: TXCD 212 and 216.

notes.div: Creative experience. This course is taught every other year. Check with adviser and/or department when planning course work.

description.div: Designing apparel, computer-aided design, pattern making, and line development for specific markets.

prerequisite.div: TXCD 209 and 216.

description.div: Creative experience in designing apparel, computer-aided design pattern making, and designing for specific markets.

prerequisite.div: TXCD 123 and 225.

description.div: Digital and other media for printed textiles. Design development, professional practices, and expressive and communicative concepts.

prerequisite.div: 4 hrs CHEM and TXCD 206.

notes.div: This course is taught every other year. Check with adviser and/or department when planning course work.

description.div: Application classes of dyes. Physical and chemical properties of dyes within each class, methods of dye-fiber association, fastness properties of dyes, and recommended application procedures.

prerequisite.div: TXCD 216; TXCD 225 or 325; TXCD 403 or 416; parallel TXCD 472.

description.div: Advanced work in the creation of apparel as visual communication. Design conceptualization with experimentation in media, structure, technique, and presentation.

prerequisite.div: TXCD 216 and 225; parallel TXCD 471. TXCD 325 and 403 recommended.

notes.div: TXCD 472 requires a public presentation of work.

description.div: Advanced work in creation of textiles. Design conceptualization, development and experimentation in media, structure, application, and product development.

prerequisite.div: Permission.

notes.div: Presented by department faculty and visiting artists, scholars and scientists.

description.div: Opportunity to analyze and evaluate techniques, develop skills, or study topics of special interest. A. Textiles (1-3 cr) B. Clothing (1-3 cr) D. Design (1-3 cr)

prerequisite.div: TXCD 213; TXCD 225 or 325; TXCD 403 OR 416

description.div: Advanced work in the creation of textiles and apparel as art forms. Design conceptualization, expression, media, technique, and presentation.

prerequisite.div: 12 hrs textiles, clothing and design or permission.

notes.div: Number of credits determined by the time spent, assignment, and sites visited.

description.div: The textile and apparel industry. Visits to museums, showrooms, manufacturers, retail establishments in major domestic and/or foreign markets such as: Chicago, Dallas, New York City, Paris, London, and Rome.

prerequisite.div: 12 hrs in textiles, clothing and design and permission.

description.div: Individual projects in research, literature review, or creative production. A. Textiles (1-5 cr) B. Clothing (1-5 cr) D. Design (1-5 cr)

prerequisite.div: For all options: 2.5 GPA, 79 hrs completed toward the degree; 3.0 GPA in TXCD courses; plus any additional prerequisites that are required for the specific option as follows. For Merchandising option: TXCD 313 and 314. For Textiles Science option: TXCD 405/805 or 406/806. For Textiles, Clothing and Design's Communications option: TXCD 314 and 407/807 or 408/808 or 410/810. For Textile and Apparel Design option: TXCD 403/803 or 416/816 or 425.

notes.div: TXCD 498 requires an application for the internship with the TXCD department and with the employer. TXCD 498 is 'Letter Grade only'.

description.div: Supervised individual professional experience with a qualified cooperative practicing professional.

prerequisite.div: Senior standing.
